I listened to it the morning it dropped after I awoke from my slumber. Initially it felt like it was 6-7 Tool songs put in a blender with a twist of The Wrist. Got up, puked. Listened to it again and knew it was, as I had suspected... Solid, Fuckin #8217; Gold. Had to ride around in the car that night after it cooled off, blaring it for the countryside to hear. Ready for the rest tomorrow.

Prepare for one of the most bone breaking experiences ever. I wish they would take a page from NIN and do their sales differently. Alas, it #8217;s a very difficult ticket to get firsthand, they will sell out every show almost immediately as tickets are released. As stated above you kinda gotta get lucky and be prepared. You #8217;re fighting legions of fans and the bots and flippers. I #8217;ve only managed to get actual tickets the last 5 odd years twice on the actual site and one of those was actually APC not Tool now that I think about it. The best seats I managed were bought off a resale site for a pretty steep up charge but totally worth it to be about 10 rows back center. It #8217;s already an expensive ticket and this one will probably be even more what with the trade war and all that Jazz.

I #8217;ve had to buy them off a resell site and it #8217;s ok if you get decent seats for 150-200 a piece, but now that #8217;s more like 265-350 now. It #8217;s his voice. And I #8217;m not sure but something happened to him between 2014ish and 2017. His voice wasn #8217;t as strong to me during that period and you could tell he was avoiding passages and doing stuff different. It wasn #8217;t until I saw him with APC right before ETE dropped that I felt his voice was back in peak form. I actually think the vocals on this are very fitting for the music. This album is very nuanced and seems to say one thing or give off this certain vibe and really I think it #8217;s just peoples own mental blockage of what this was supposed to sound like. The more I listen to it then more it sounds like itself. Despite all the callbacks and reminiscing going on.

That angry white male subset hijacks everything. Lots of Tool #8217;s music is explicitly against most of this shit. Thinking for yourself and questioning authority etc etc. I #8217;m not sure the sexist tropes are that and not either jokes or actual deep looks at darker subjects. They aren #8217;t for everyone. Maynard #8217;s Dick I guess? I think some people are so dense that no matter how woke they are they won #8217;t ever learn to fucking laugh at the absurdity of it all sometimes. 2011- Puscifer on the Conditions Tour, unbelievably good. 2014- Tool in Austin. Amazing. First song I ever heard them play was Third Eye. Had great seats and walked in transfixed. 2015- Volto in Anaheim. Unreal. Barely got in, maybe 100 people max standing room. Finished it up with their version of No Quarter. Got to watch Danny up close and personal and shake his hand and tell him thanks for everything afterwards. Mind blowing. 2015 Tool Monster Mash in Tempe Arizona on Halloween. Incredibly packed festival show. Over 30k people, probably the most people I #8217;ve been around outside of a college football game. Obviously they came out dressed as Zep and played No Quarter but not half as good as Volto. They were a bit rusty but by the end of the set were hitting on all cylinders. Got super high and then black lung from 700 million second hand cigarettes. And I smoked then. Hahaha. 2015 Puscifer on the Money Shot Tour in Dallas. Had VIP tickets. Could actually hear their amplifiers and hear their voices singing. Felt like you could reach out and grab them. Awesome performance early on that tour when you could tell they were figuring it out still. 2016 Tool in Dallas. Sort of a repeat but indoors and it #8217;s me and girls favorite band. Didn #8217;t have the greatest seats but it didn #8217;t matter. A good time was had. 2017 APC finally after all these years in Dallas. Fucking badass show, they sounded great and had the whole place moving. Really good energy that night. 2019 Tool. Finally after almost 26 years of listening to these goofballs on cassette on my Walkman in middle school riding the bus I will see them in my home town of Tulsa Oklahoma. I passed on lots of shows when I was younger because I didn #8217;t like crowds and had other shit going that I felt was more important. Haha what a fool. My good friend who died a couple years back would never shut up about good they were live but I never saw them until after he had passed oddly enough. My gf has seen them Tool 8 times going back to the #198;nima tour and thinks they #8217;re lame now. Hahahahaha

I was crying here and there for sure. Had been through a really tough time leading up to that show and barely made it there. It was like going to Church and Jesus actually being there. Good stuff. I can #8217;t wait for the next album.
And Carina is amazing! I love to watch her older stuff from before she joined. You can really see what Maynard saw in her.

That #8217;s where I saw them on the Money Shot your. We raced back from Arizona to see them on the first indoor show. We got stuck in the awesome traffic on 75 and we were late. Walked in after the first song was already started and had to go right up to the second row. I could feel Maynard giving me the #8220;who the fuck are these assholes #8221; eyes. Hahahaha. I need to go to another show there and really check the place out. We were both sick from traveling and that was a tough show physically. Monster mash killed us as well 3 days before that. We were pretty close but we had to stand in the same spot for 6 hours.
